changesets.comments:
misc: fixed clang warning in renderer 2, refs #360

"conversion from string literal to 'char *' is deprecated"
misc: fixed duplicate 'static’ declaration clang warning, refs #360

renderer2: fix for R_LoadPSK when stream for pointIndex is out of
range/NULL refs #360 , print warnings for empty/NULL streams
misc: fixed uninitialized variable warning, refs #360
misc: fixed several compiler warnings and removed unused vars, refs #360
misc: removed unnecessary va() when calling G_Printf, warning fix, refs #360
misc: removed unnecessary va() when calling G_Printf, warning fix, refs #360
misc: removed unecessary comparison, warning fix, refs #360
qcommon: warning fix refs #360

ui: clang warning fix refs #360 - make 'force' in
UI_BuildServerDisplayList actually work
game: clang warning fix refs #360
Fixing incorrect memset size
ui: fixed clang warning, refs #360
general: fixed tinygettext clang warning, refs #360
renderer: commented out unused functions, refs #360

game: clang warning fix refs #360 - travis ci build of gcc & clang is
free of warnings
general: clang warnings fixes, refs #360
renderer2: fixed clang warning, refs #360
renderer2: fixed 32/64 bit clang warning, refs #360

server: fixed clang warnings, refs #360

journals.notes:
I tested the last commit which fixes duplicate 'static' declaration warnings with clang and gcc-llvm on Mac. Please let me know if I broke the build on linux or Windows (but I don't think I did)

_EDIT:_ works fine on Windows
_EDIT #2:_ works fine on linux as well

journals.notes:
4. should be fixed. 

We now notice when 'pointIndex' stream has issues (-1 case of MemStreamGetX) 
The return of -1 for bad cases in MemStreamGetX functions is a big hack ...

IR4T4 wrote: > 4. should be fixed. Not quite. Three exactly same if statements showed up further down the code: 
In function ‘R_LoadPSK’:
etlegacy/src/renderer2/tr_model_psk.c:348: warning: comparison is always false due to limited range of data type
etlegacy/src/renderer2/tr_model_psk.c:399: warning: comparison is always false due to limited range of data type
etlegacy/src/renderer2/tr_model_psk.c:409: warning: comparison is always false due to limited range of data type
Is the above description of warnings still valid?

I don't think so, but I've a couple of other warnings with clang:

* -src/ui/ui_main.c:4076:17: warning: format string is not a string literal (potentially insecure) [-Wformat-security]-
* -src/ui/ui_main.c:8390:14: warning: format string is not a string literal (potentially insecure) [-Wformat-security]-
* -src/ui/ui_main.c:5433:12: warning: comparison of constant 2 with expression of type 'qboolean' is always false-

* -src/cgame/cg_debriefing.c:3236:27: warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type 'team_t' is always false-
* -src/cgame/cg_limbopanel.c:3291:11: warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type 'weapon_t' is always false-
* -src/cgame/cg_limbopanel.c:3317:12: warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type 'weapon_t' is always true-
* -src/cgame/cg_players.c:3288:22: warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type 'weapon_t' is always true-

* -src/qcommon/cmd.c:1103:7: warning: implicit declaration of function 'FS_OSStatFile' is invalid in C99-
* -src/qcommon/cmd.c:1103:7: warning: implicit declaration of function 'FS_OSStatFile' is invalid in C99-

* -src/game/g_cmds.c:1421:11: warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type 'weapon_t' is always false-
* -src/game/g_cmds.c:1444:12: warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type 'weapon_t' is always true-
* -src/game/g_cmds.c:2478:16: warning: comparison of constant 2 with expression of type 'qboolean' is always false-

* -src/game/g_character.c:120:36: warning: 'memset' call operates on objects of type 'animModelInfo_t' while the size is based-
* -src/game/g_character.c:120:36: note: did you mean to dereference the argument to 'sizeof'-
* -src/game/g_syscalls.c:210:29: warning: 'memset' call operates on objects of type 'trace_t' while the size is based on a different type 'trace_t *'-

* -src/game/g_svcmds.c:1113:3: warning: implicit declaration of function 'G_MatchOnePlayer' is invalid in C99-
* -src/game/g_svcmds.c:1343:13: warning: unused variable 'reason'-
The team_t and weapont_t related warnings are fixed. Travis CI doesn't show any clang warnings. Can we close this?

For the first time in the history of ET:L there is not a single warning during compilation with clang! 

However, as was discussed on the irc channel, changing function parameters from weapon_t to integer in order to fix warnings "warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type" is not the best way to handle it. The better fix is to just cast the -1 to weapon_t and not the other way around.

Radegast wrote:

> However, as was discussed on the irc channel, changing function parameters from weapon_t to integer in order to fix warnings "warning: comparison of constant -1 with expression of type" is not the best way to handle it. The better fix is to just cast the -1 to weapon_t and not the other way around.

I don't fully agree .. at least for the changes I did related to function params. If the function deals with -1 and a param of -1 is valid - in that case the param range is -1 and all the weapon enums which is int. Well, finally it's a kind of taste ... just change it if you want to.
Radegast if you want to see code changed just do it. We have no clang warnings anymore and I'll close this now.

I still have quite a few warning (mostly related to the abs function), maybe because I use a recent version of clang (3.5.0)?

Edit: Yes, seems related to "clang 3.5.0":http://llvm.org/releases/3.5.0/tools/clang/docs/ReleaseNotes.html (now fixed).
Good to know it's fully fixed now. Clang build didn't show issues with abs function see https://travis-ci.org/etlegacy/etlegacy

Yes, that's because Travis uses clang 3.4 :)

>    $ clang --version
>   clang version 3.4 (tags/RELEASE_34/final)

In "4f51411":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/4f51411bbf748113a8f6c00a16f2bea03411f406 , I fixed a warning that I got when compiling in 64bits. However, now when cross compiling in 32 bits I got the very same, but inverse warning: 
/home/remy/dev/etlegacy/src/renderer2/tr_world.c:1587:27: warning: format specifies type 'long' but the argument has type     
      'int' [-Wformat]
                Ren_LogComment("%li, ", node - tr.world->nodes);
                                ~~~     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                                %i

Casting the result to long should be OK since @long >= int@ 
Ren_LogComment("%li, ", (long)(node - tr.world->nodes));
